div1.p: The letter fragment referencing “Maya Chronicles,” is written in both Mayan and English.

div1.head: Letter fragment from J. Martinez Hernandez to [Henry Rose Carter], July 14, 1923
div1.p:
11.
Part of Dr. Martinez' Letter of July 14/23.

“Maya Chronicles:
P. 142, Can ahau: uchi maya-cimlal ocnal kuchil ych paa
(4 ahau happened the Maya deaths pestilence when turkey buzzards
entered the houses to eat the dead inside of the City of Mayapan.)
P. 156: can ahau: uchci maya-cimlal: uchci ocnakuchil yehhpaa.

P. 168: can ahau, te chabi atiku he u tunilac: lay u katunil uchci maya
cimlal tu hopiz tun ychil can ahau u kalunil uale.
(in the fifth year of the course of katun 4 ahau: 1485).
Fol. 15: P. 29 of Tizimin MSS: (see over the predictions)

Can Can ahau u kinil tu chichen Itza, can ahau u katunil xan, u
kalai (?) u miaznatil ychil u anahteil vai cu hoksabal ti yunil nitun
dzala chactemal tah uaymel holtun ytza, ti cici ilabi xan tu tohil than
tu yunil “repertorio” manan cipani cautzac yoheltabal ca bin kuchuc tu
kinil u cumtal hun hun dzit katun u cuch katunob, lecil u natabal u cuch num-
ya tzolan tac ti u talel te kin lecil u benil dzacab kin cu talele-------
(e ahau is the day that corresponds to Chichen Itza; four ahau is
also the name of the katun” this is the record of science contained in
the ritual book: here it has been written or copied in paper in Nitun
Dzala in the province of Chetumal in waymil holliun ytza: there also it
was well seen that the commandments or predictions are rightly written in
